Key Arguments: The draft legislation is difficult to understand and misleading.
The proposed ACMA powers represent a political and bureaucratic overreach akin to totalitarian regimes.
The exclusion of government statements from the legislation is hypocritical, as governments have previously disseminated misinformation.
The legislation threatens freedom of speech, expression, and choice.
The bill is perceived as a tool for the government to censor opposition and control information.
The bill could lead to increased censorship by social media companies to avoid fines.
The best remedy to misinformation is free and open debate, not government-imposed censorship.
Notable Quotes: The plan to introduce these new ACMA powers is a gross, even sinister political and bureaucratic overreach.
This is Big Brother government, taking away individuals freedom of speech, freedom of expression and freedom of choice.
In reality this Bill, instead of ‘Keeping us safe online’ is really about ‘Keeping us in the dark online’!
A good government should trust the public they work for, to process and critique what they read and see online, accordingly.
